summary: The concept of "workers' movement" within the EU legal and regulatory framework pertains to the rights and freedoms associated with the mobility of workers across member states. This movement is a fundamental principle enshrined in the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union (TFEU), promoting the free movement of persons. It encompasses various aspects, including the right to seek employment, reside, and work in any EU country without discrimination. The regulatory measures aim to enhance labor market integration and ensure equitable treatment of workers, thereby fostering social cohesion and economic growth within the internal market.
